[XV

Ben]127-ben took [[his]127-ben boy]3426-his boy and went back to [[his]127-ben cattle ranch in [California]29-california]2306-his cattle ranch in california , and [he]127-ben returned under very comfortable circumstances . Just before [his]127-ben going , [Mr. Havisham]51-mr. havisham had an interview with [him]127-ben in which [the lawyer]2506-the lawyer told [him]127-ben that [the Earl of [Dorincourt]41-dorincourt]2471-the earl of dorincourt wished to do something for [the boy who might have turned out to be [Lord Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy]2309-the boy who might have turned out to be lord fauntleroy , and so [he]127-ben had decided that it would be a good plan to invest in [a cattle ranch]2061-a cattle ranch of [his]127-ben own , and put [Ben]127-ben in charge of it on terms which would make it pay [him]127-ben very well , and which would lay a foundation for [[his]127-ben son]198-his son 's future . And so when [Ben]127-ben went away , [he]127-ben went as [the prospective master of [a ranch which would be almost as good as [his]127-ben own]2313-a ranch which would be almost as good as his own , and might easily become [his]127-ben own in time , as indeed it did in the course of a few years]2312-the prospective master of a ranch which would be almost as good as his own , and might easily become his own in time , as indeed it did in the course of a few years ; and [Tom]79-thomas , [the boy]2518-the boy , grew up on [it]2313-a ranch which would be almost as good as his own into [a fine young man]2315-a fine young man and was devotedly fond of [[his]79-thomas father]150-his father ; and [they]2317-they were so successful and happy that [Ben]127-ben used to say that [Tom]79-thomas made up to [him]127-ben for all the troubles [he]127-ben had ever had . But [Dick]59-dick and [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs who had actually come over with [the others to see that things were properly looked after]2318-the others to see that things were properly looked after did not return for some time . It had been decided at the outset that [the Earl]203-the earl would provide for [Dick]59-dick , and would see that [he]59-dick received a solid education ; and [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs had decided that as [he]46-mr. hobbs [himself]46-mr. hobbs had left [a reliable substitute in charge of [[his]46-mr. hobbs store]280-his store]2320-a reliable substitute in charge of his store , [he]46-mr. hobbs could afford to wait to see the festivities which were to celebrate [Lord Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy 's eighth birthday . [All the tenantry]2322-all the tenantry were invited , and there were to be feasting and dancing and games in [the park]403-the park , and bonfires and fire - works in the evening . " Just like the Fourth of July ! "[50-fauntleroy] said [Lord Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy . " It seems a pity [my]50-fauntleroy birthday was n't on the Fourth , does n't it ? For then [we]3600-we could keep [them]2325-them both together . "[50-fauntleroy] It must be confessed that at first [the Earl]203-the earl and [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs were not as intimate as it might have been hoped [they]2325-them would become , in the interests of [the British aristocracy]2019-the british aristocracy . The fact was that [the Earl]203-the earl had known [very few grocery - men]2328-very few grocery - men , and [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs had not had many very close acquaintances who were [earls]298-earls ; and so in [their]2325-them rare interviews conversation did not flourish . It must also be owned that [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs had been rather overwhelmed by the splendors [Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy felt it [his]50-fauntleroy duty to show [him]46-mr. hobbs . The entrance gate and the stone lions and [the avenue]802-the avenue impressed [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs somewhat at the beginning , and when [he]46-mr. hobbs saw [the Castle]402-the castle , and [the flower - gardens]2332-the flower - gardens , and [the hot - houses]2333-the hot - houses , and [the terraces]2334-the terraces , and the peacocks , and [the dungeon]2335-the dungeon , and the armor , and the great staircase , and [the stables]2944-the stables , and [the liveried servants]2337-the liveried servants , [he]46-mr. hobbs really was quite bewildered . But it was [the picture gallery]2338-the picture gallery which seemed to be the finishing stroke . " Somethin' in the manner of [a museum]3601-a museum ? "[46-mr. hobbs] [he]46-mr. hobbs said to [Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy , when [he]46-mr. hobbs was led into [the great , beautiful room]2339-the great , beautiful room . " N no ! "[50-fauntleroy] said [Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy , rather doubtfully . " [I]50-fauntleroy do n't THINK it 's [a museum]3601-a museum . [[My]50-fauntleroy grandfather]3090-my grandfather says these are [[my]50-fauntleroy ancestors]3604-my ancestors . "[50-fauntleroy] " [[Your]46-mr. hobbs aunt 's sisters]3605-your aunt 's sisters ! "[46-mr. hobbs] ejaculated [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs . " ALL of ['em]3606-'em ? [[Your]46-mr. hobbs great - uncle]3607-your great - uncle , [he]3607-your great - uncle MUST have had [a family]3608-a family ! Did [he]3607-your great - uncle raise ['em]3606-'em all ? "[46-mr. hobbs] And [he]46-mr. hobbs sank into a seat and looked around [him]46-mr. hobbs with quite an agitated countenance , until with the greatest difficulty [Lord Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy managed to explain that the walls were not lined entirely with the portraits of [the progeny of [[his]46-mr. hobbs great - uncle]2341-his great - uncle]2340-the progeny of his great - uncle . [He]50-fauntleroy found it necessary , in fact , to call in the assistance of [Mrs. Mellon]72-mrs. mellon , who knew all about the pictures , and could tell who painted them and when , and who added romantic stories of [the lords]2342-the lords and [ladies who were the originals]2343-ladies who were the originals . When [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs once understood , and had heard some of these stories , [he]46-mr. hobbs was very much fascinated and liked [the picture gallery]2338-the picture gallery almost better than anything else ; and [he]46-mr. hobbs would often walk over from [the village]1168-the village , where [he]46-mr. hobbs staid at [the Dorincourt Arms]38-the dorincourt arms , and would spend half an hour or so wandering about [the gallery]2346-the gallery , staring at [the painted ladies]2347-the painted ladies and gentlemen , who also stared at [him]46-mr. hobbs , and shaking [his]46-mr. hobbs head nearly all the time . " And [they]298-earls was [all earls]3609-all earls ! "[46-mr. hobbs] [he]46-mr. hobbs would say , " er pretty nigh it ! An ' [HE]46-mr. hobbs 'S goin' to be one of 'em , an ' own it all ! "[46-mr. hobbs] Privately [he]46-mr. hobbs was not nearly so much disgusted with [earls]298-earls and [their]298-earls mode of life as [he]46-mr. hobbs had expected to be , and it is to be doubted whether [his]46-mr. hobbs strictly republican principles were not shaken a little by a closer acquaintance with [castles]339-castles and [ancestors]2350-ancestors and all the rest of it . At any rate , one day [he]46-mr. hobbs uttered a very remarkable and unexpected sentiment : " [I]46-mr. hobbs would n't have minded bein ' one of 'em [myself]46-mr. hobbs ! "[46-mr. hobbs] [he]46-mr. hobbs said which was really a great concession . What a grand day it was when [little Lord Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy 's birthday arrived , and how [[his]50-fauntleroy young lordship]2570-his young lordship enjoyed it ! How beautiful [the park]403-the park looked , filled with [the thronging people]2353-the thronging people dressed in [their]2353-the thronging people gayest and best , and with the flags flying from the tents and [the top of [the Castle]402-the castle]2354-the top of the castle ! [Nobody]2417-nobody had staid away who could possibly come , because [everybody]452-everybody was really glad that [little Lord Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy was to be [little Lord Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy still , and some day was to be [the master of everything]2358-the master of everything . [Every one]184-every one wanted to have a look at [him]50-fauntleroy , and at [[his]50-fauntleroy pretty , kind mother , who had made [so many friends]2361-so many friends]2360-his pretty , kind mother , who had made so many friends . And positively [every one]184-every one liked [the Earl]203-the earl rather better , and felt more amiably toward [him]203-the earl because [the little boy]153-the little boy loved and trusted [him]203-the earl so , and because , also , [he]203-the earl had now made [friends]378-friends with and behaved respectfully to [[his]203-the earl heir 's mother]2304-his heir 's mother . It was said that [he]203-the earl was even beginning to be fond of [her]2304-his heir 's mother , too , and that between [[his]203-the earl young lordship]2570-his young lordship and [[his]203-the earl young lordship 's mother]2368-his young lordship 's mother , [the Earl]203-the earl might be changed in time into quite [a well - behaved old nobleman]2370-a well - behaved old nobleman , and [everybody]452-everybody might be happier and better off . What scores and scores of [people there]2372-people there were under the trees , and in [the tents]2373-the tents , and on the lawns ! [Farmers]1867-farmers and [[farmers]1867-farmers ' wives]2376-farmers ' wives in [their]2377-their Sunday suits and bonnets and shawls ; [girls]2378-girls and [[their]2378-girls sweethearts]2379-their sweethearts ; [children]2556-children frolicking and chasing about ; and [old dames in red cloaks]2381-old dames in red cloaks gossiping together . [Lady Lorredaile]139-lady lorredaile and [Sir Harry]115-sir harry were [there]221-there , and [Sir Thomas Asshe]121-sir thomas asshe of asshawe hall , being in erleboro and [[his]121-sir thomas asshe of asshawe hall , being in erleboro daughters]2387-his daughters , and [Mr. Havisham]51-mr. havisham , of course , and then beautiful [Miss Vivian Herbert]122-miss vivian herbert , with the loveliest white gown and lace parasol , and [a circle of [gentlemen]2465-gentlemen]2388-a circle of gentlemen to take care of [her]122-miss vivian herbert though [she]122-miss vivian herbert evidently liked [Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy better than all of [them]2465-gentlemen put together . "[122-miss vivian herbert] And afterward [she]122-miss vivian herbert walked about [the grounds]2391-the grounds with [him]50-fauntleroy , and let [him]50-fauntleroy show [her]122-miss vivian herbert everything . [I]50-fauntleroy told [them]2392-them how pretty [you]122-miss vivian herbert were , and [I]50-fauntleroy told [them]2392-them [they]2392-them should see [you]122-miss vivian herbert if [you]122-miss vivian herbert came to [my]50-fauntleroy birthday , "[50-fauntleroy] [she]122-miss vivian herbert shook hands with [them]2392-them both , and stood and talked to [them]2392-them in [her]122-miss vivian herbert prettiest way , asking [them]2392-them about [America]2-america and [their]2392-them voyage and [their]2392-them life since [they]2392-them had been in [England]1-england ; while [Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy stood by , looking up at [her]122-miss vivian herbert with adoring eyes , and [his]50-fauntleroy cheeks quite flushed with delight because [he]50-fauntleroy saw that [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs and [Dick]59-dick liked [her]122-miss vivian herbert so much . " Well , "[59-dick] said [Dick]59-dick solemnly , afterward , ' [she]122-miss vivian herbert 's [the daisiest gal [I]0-i ever saw]2393-the daisiest gal i ever saw ! [She]122-miss vivian herbert 's well , [she]122-miss vivian herbert 's just a daisy , that 's what [she]122-miss vivian herbert is , ' n ' no mistake ! " [Everybody]452-everybody looked after [her]122-miss vivian herbert as [she]122-miss vivian herbert passed , and [every one]184-every one looked after [little Lord Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy . And the sun shone and the flags fluttered and the games were played and the dances danced , and as the gayeties went on and the joyous afternoon passed , [[his]50-fauntleroy little lordship]1034-his little lordship was simply radiantly happy . [The whole world]3616-the whole world seemed beautiful to [him]50-fauntleroy . There was [some one else who was happy]3617-some one else who was happy , too , [an old man , who , though [he]50-fauntleroy had been rich and noble all [his]50-fauntleroy life]3618-an old man , who , though he had been rich and noble all his life , had not often been very honestly happy . Perhaps , indeed , [I]50-fauntleroy shall tell [you]3619-you that [I]50-fauntleroy think it was because [he]50-fauntleroy was rather better than [he]50-fauntleroy had been that [he]50-fauntleroy was rather happier . [He]50-fauntleroy had not , indeed , suddenly become as good as [Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy thought [him]50-fauntleroy ; but , at least , [he]50-fauntleroy had begun to love something , and [he]50-fauntleroy had several times found a sort of pleasure in doing the kind things which the innocent , kind little heart of [a child]2490-a child had suggested , and that was a beginning . And every day [he]50-fauntleroy had been more pleased with [[[his]50-fauntleroy son]198-his son 's wife]1462-his son 's wife . It was true , as [the people]644-the people said , that [he]50-fauntleroy was beginning to like [her]1462-his son 's wife too . [He]50-fauntleroy liked to hear [her]1462-his son 's wife sweet voice and to see [her]1462-his son 's wife sweet face ; and as [he]50-fauntleroy sat in [his]50-fauntleroy arm - chair , [he]50-fauntleroy used to watch [her]1462-his son 's wife and listen as [she]1462-his son 's wife talked to [[her]1462-his son 's wife boy]1751-her boy ; and [he]50-fauntleroy heard loving , gentle words which were new to [him]50-fauntleroy , and [he]50-fauntleroy began to see why [the little fellow who had lived in [a [New York]4-new york side street]3626-a new york side street and known [grocery - men]3627-grocery - men and made friends with [boot - blacks]3628-boot - blacks]3625-the little fellow who had lived in a new york side street and known grocery - men and made friends with boot - blacks , was still so well - bred and manly a little fellow that [he]50-fauntleroy made [no one]2413-no one ashamed of [him]50-fauntleroy , even when fortune changed [him]50-fauntleroy into [the heir to [an English earldom]3631-an english earldom , living in [an English castle]2215-an english castle]3630-the heir to an english earldom , living in an english castle . It was really a very simple thing , after all , it was only that [he]50-fauntleroy had lived near a kind and gentle heart , and had been taught to think kind thoughts always and to care for [others]436-others . It is a very little thing , perhaps , but it is the best thing of all . [He]50-fauntleroy knew nothing of [earls]298-earls and [castles]339-castles ; [he]50-fauntleroy was quite ignorant of all grand and splendid things ; but [he]50-fauntleroy was always lovable because [he]50-fauntleroy was simple and loving . To be so is like being born [a king]443-a king . As [the old Earl of Dorincourt]3637-the old earl of dorincourt looked at [him]50-fauntleroy that day , moving about [the park]403-the park among [the people]644-the people , talking to those [he]50-fauntleroy knew and making [his]50-fauntleroy ready little bow when [any one]233-any one greeted [him]50-fauntleroy , entertaining [[his]50-fauntleroy friends]2619-his friends [Dick]59-dick and [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs , or standing near [[his]50-fauntleroy mother]151-his mother or [Miss Herbert]122-miss vivian herbert listening to [their]2619-his friends conversation , [the old nobleman]897-the old nobleman was very well satisfied with [him]50-fauntleroy . And [he]50-fauntleroy had never been better satisfied than [he]50-fauntleroy was when [they]2619-his friends went down to [the biggest tent]3644-the biggest tent , where [the more important tenants of [the Dorincourt estate]3646-the dorincourt estate]3645-the more important tenants of the dorincourt estate were sitting down to the grand collation of the day . [They]2619-his friends were drinking toasts ; and , after [they]2619-his friends had drunk the health of [the Earl]203-the earl , with much more enthusiasm than [his]203-the earl name had ever been greeted with before , [they]2619-his friends proposed the health of "[50-fauntleroy] [Little Lord Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy . " And if there had ever been any doubt at all as to whether [his]203-the earl lordship was popular or not , it would have been settled that instant . Such a clamor of voices , and such a rattle of glasses and applause ! [They]2619-his friends had begun to like [him]203-the earl so much , [those warm - hearted people]3648-those warm - hearted people , that [they]2619-his friends forgot to feel any restraint before [the ladies and gentlemen from [the castle]402-the castle , who had come to see [them]2619-his friends]3649-the ladies and gentlemen from the castle , who had come to see them . [They]2619-his friends made quite a decent uproar , and [one or two motherly women]3651-one or two motherly women looked tenderly at [the little fellow where [he]50-fauntleroy stood , with [[his]50-fauntleroy mother]151-his mother on one side and [the Earl]203-the earl on the other]3652-the little fellow where he stood , with his mother on one side and the earl on the other , and grew quite moist about the eyes , and said to [one another]2108-one another : "[50-fauntleroy] God bless [him]50-fauntleroy , [the pretty little dear]2394-the pretty little dear ! " [Little Lord Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy was delighted . [He]50-fauntleroy stood and smiled , and made bows , and flushed rosy red with pleasure up to the roots of [his]50-fauntleroy bright hair . "[50-fauntleroy] Is it because [they]2395-they like [me]0-i , [Dearest]2411-dearest ? " [he]50-fauntleroy said to [[his]50-fauntleroy mother]151-his mother . "[2395-they] Is it , [Dearest]2411-dearest ? [I]0-i 'm so glad ! " And then [the Earl]203-the earl put [his]203-the earl hand on [the child]2539-the child 's shoulder and said to [him]50-fauntleroy : "[50-fauntleroy] [Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy , say to [them]2395-they that [you]50-fauntleroy thank [them]2395-they for [their]2395-they kindness . " [Fauntleroy]50-fauntleroy gave a glance up at [him]50-fauntleroy and then at [[his]50-fauntleroy mother]151-his mother . "[0-i] Must [I]0-i ? " [he]50-fauntleroy asked just a trifle shyly , and [she]151-his mother smiled , and so did [Miss Herbert]122-miss vivian herbert , and [they]2395-they both nodded . " And amid the shouts and clamor of applause , [he]50-fauntleroy stepped back with a little sigh of relief , and put [his]50-fauntleroy hand into [the Earl]203-the earl 's and stood close to [him]203-the earl , smiling and leaning against [his]50-fauntleroy side . And that would be the very end of [my]3090-my grandfather story ; but [I]3090-my grandfather must add one curious piece of information , which is that [Mr. Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs became so fascinated with high life and was so reluctant to leave [[his]46-mr. hobbs young friend]2456-his young friend that [he]46-mr. hobbs actually sold [[his]46-mr. hobbs corner store in [New York]4-new york]3663-his corner store in new york , and settled in [the English village of Erlesboro]3664-the english village of erlesboro , where [he]46-mr. hobbs opened [a shop which was patronized by [the Castle]402-the castle]3665-a shop which was patronized by the castle and consequently was a great success . And though [he]46-mr. hobbs and [the Earl]203-the earl never became very intimate , if [you]3668-you will believe [me]3090-my grandfather , [[that man]3669-that man [Hobbs]46-mr. hobbs]3670-that man hobbs became in time more aristocratic than [[his]46-mr. hobbs lordship [himself]46-mr. hobbs]3671-his lordship himself , and [he]46-mr. hobbs read the Court news every morning , and followed all the doings of [the House of [Lords]2440-lords]2900-the house of lords !
